title.narrative: Challenges & Barriers of the Lebanese Female Candidates in the Parliamentary Elections 2018.

description.narrative: This research aims to explore the experiences and challenges of candidates in the 2018 parliamentary elections which took place in May 2018. It summarizes observations and lessons learned making them available to interested female candidates and diﬀerent stakeholders for the next mandate in 2022.

activity-date.narrative: After concudting the study, the ﬁndings imply that women interested in political life will continue working on achieving their goals, especially after immensely learning from their ﬁrst electoral experience in 2018. A big majority of independent and politically aﬃliated women intend to participate in the 2022 elections.

This study is conducted for the very first time in Lebanon by fiftyfifty previously known as Women in front under the project entitled "COWP - Counselling Office for Women in Politics" & supported by Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Lebanon.

recipient-country.narrative: This reaserach study is conducted only for Lebanonfor the very first time, on the Challenges and Barriers of 100 Female Candidates during the 2018 Parliamentary elections.

title.narrative: Lebanese Female Candidates: Challenges & Barriers of Lebanese Candidates during Parliamentary Elections 2018.

description.narrative: This research aims to explore the experiences and challenges of candidates in the 2018 parliamentary elections which took place in May 2018. It summarizes observations and lessons learned making them available to interested female candidates and diﬀerent stakeholders for the next mandate in 2022.
